comment: The smartbook assignments usually have over 100 concepts which means it is at least 200 question (if you get them all correct.) Then there is a lab and quiz you have to complete. All 3 are due every two weeks. It is easy but the smartbooks are so time consuming I'm sure there are other professors that don't give as much work.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: I am currently a senior Biology major after taking and succeeding well in high-level chemistry and biology classes. GEOG 3315 is the most challenging college class I have ever taken, especially for an intro-level course. I spend 5-7 hours a week on just this class alone. Exams are building maps and applying skills.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: 4-week class was very straight forward, labs have unlimited attempts, quizzes, smartbook. Some chapters are easier than others. You should be able to get a A if you put in the work/do your work. All assignments are open on the 1st day of classes. He offers some extra credit. Overall, easy class with chill professor. Take him if possible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: This class is probably the easiest summer class I've taken online. Though we have 8 modules and 8 labs, everything is pretty self explanatory and he gives a good amount of time to complete them all. This class is very easy to finish even before the 4 weeks is up. There's no final, tests, or anything like that. Be prepared to do long labs/ modules.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Summer- It was a lot of work but it was very easy. Take him. This class is mainly about you putting in the time to do the work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Patterson is a genuine guy who cares a lot about his class and students. The class itself is pretty easy, but the smartbook work is a draaag. Make sure you leave yourself a couple days to do the smartbook assignments because theyre kinda a pain to do in one night. Easy, but time consuming. I definitely recommend this class and professor.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Inspirational--Caring

comment: Gave lots of easy/quick extra credit opportunities. Assignments take some time but are not difficult. Very accessible through email and helpful. Easy A if you keep up with homework.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: A lot of work for what the course is worth. It takes so much time to do the reading and answer the questions. The questions are designed to master "topics" and there are about 110 topics per assignment. It takes several questions to master one topic, so it ends up being around 500 questions. There is also a lab and a quiz. Everything due biweekly.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: I took this class online. The syllabus is straightforward and there is a LOT of homework on Connect, but as long as you take the time to do them, it is easy. There are labs for each module and he gave us the chance to take it until we were comfortable with our grade. The quizzes were decent but very heavy in the material. Overall not a bad choice.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Test heavy

comment: Professor left a bad impression when in the first week he sent out email whining that too many people saw the hidden word in syllabus to get 3 extra points to your final grade and took it away from everyone. The class has of tests that are 60% of your grade but are online and smart books that take 3.5 hours and labs like people with unlimited tries
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: So I took the four-week course with Dr. Patterson for GEOG 1113. We had 8 sketches due. The sketches come from the book, and you're told to be specific and detailed with the drawings. I should of got a B, but got a C, and was told I plagiarized because it was like the book, verbatim. ALL OF THE SKETCHS WERE, AND YOU GIVE 0 FOR THE LAST 2??????????
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: Class consists of only LS, quizzes, and labs. As long as you do the LS, you'll get a 100 and you can take the labs until you get whatever grade you want. I did the class in about a month, not too hard. No final

I finished this class within the first 2 months of the semester. I don't enjoy school work but I would do the assignments when I was bored just to kill time as they took close to no thinking. Everything is open for you to complete when you start the class. Grade consists of LS, quizzes that can be found online & labs that you have unlimited trys on
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Just do the learnsmart activities, quizzes, and labs. Labs you can take till you get a 100 and LS is a 100 as long as you do it. He gives out extra credit too. Very accessible outside of class. Assignments are due every 2 weeks. Course takes no more than an hour and a half to do the work for every 2 weeks
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: He was pretty nice and would often send out announcements regarding questions. It is a lot of work though and he does expect students to put a lot of time into the course. The labs are easy and you have unlimited attempts to get a 100%. The chapter quizzes are a little harder and are very specific to the chapters. No final and there is extra credit
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Class is very easy but is time consuming. Software is difficult to use at first but he helps out and is understanding about it. Overall an easy class and would definitely take him again!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: His tests are very challenging as you don't have any time to flip through the book to look for answers.  You MUST memorize every chapter.  Take another class like sci1102.  Ten times easier.  Landforms sounds easy but it is ridiculously hard.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: You have to do a tedious lab each week and take a quiz.  The labs are quite difficult.  The ready is difficult and the tests cover 3 chapters with nit picky questions.  He makes his own tests, so you better memorize this difficult subject matter forwards and backwards.  Very hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: His tests are impossible.  Can't google answers.  Less than 30 seconds a question.  You really have to memorize the book.  Made a C with a lot of effort.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: I took this class during online during the 4-week summer session. It was really easy just make sure you stay on top of the work. Some of the assignments were a little messed up and frustrating but he was very understanding and will accommodate the assignments to help you. The tests are a little long but theres only 4 along with 8 labs.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Good overall
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Respected

comment: Loved this class! Made Geography fun to take. You won't regret taking this class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Each test is over 2 chapters and the questions are very picky.  However, if you actually read the book and study you should make an A or B on his tests.  People who do poorly are lazy.  Labs are interesting and challenging, but he gives you multiple attempts so no one should complain.  I would take him again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: His class isn't terribly hard if you read all the material and spend a decent amount of time on the labs. 5 exams, which are a bit tricky, but I've gotten As on every single assignment. The labs itself are more difficult in my opinion. This isn't an Easy A class, but passing it isn't difficult either.

He's impossible to contact unless you reply to an open discussion board. A (easy) lab is due every week which means completing a set of activities using google earth and answering 40 questions about it. His exam q's are unsolvable and word-for-word from these labs. Ex: "What is the slope of this mountain?" (no picture or name of mountain included)

This class is difficult because the google earth labs are so so so confusing.  Everyone panics the day  before labs are due because the labs have no correct multiple choice answers.  You will pull your hair out.

Don't take this class with a full load because it requires a lot of reading and labwork.  The material is overload.  The tests are hard and tricky. It's better to take it in the classroom so you can ask questions about the labs.  Too much work for a C.

Do not think that this is an easy class.  You have to read the chapters carefully and study hard to pass the tests.  The labs will take you quite a while to complete as you will get stumped when you discover there is not a correct answer to the question.  Pulled a B, but I worked my tail off.
Hard class with  hard labs. Lots of book reading. Take sci 1101 instead because it is much easier.

I took the online class and it is a lot of work and reading. You have to work hard for your grade. The labs take hours to do and many errors can be found in the labs, which is quite frustrating.  If someone would fix the question/answer set for the labs, the course would be much more enjoyable.  Beware
labs are ridiculous with questions that don't even have the correct answers listed in multiple choice.

Taking this online class was the best decision I made in choosing a class. Especially for summer. It took a little time to complete the labs but I cannot complain. Dr. Patterson is nice and willing to compromise with grades. TAKE HIS CLASS. I ended up with an A in his class!

VERY easy class. Took online, had one assignment due every week, and 5 tests-very straightforward. Was a little slow answering questions, but usually there aren't any. Def recommend for an online class!

Dr. Patterson is a tough professor. He gives opportunities to earn extra credit. Read the book. Do the practice quizzes. You must put time into the class. The test are definitely hard. He is a fair professor, but this is not an easy class.

This class was extremely easy and also not to boring. Professor Patterson knows his stuff and his tests come straight from the book and his notes that he posts online. I never once had to stay for the lab period because they can be completed at home. A pretty easy A as long as you study a little and do the labs.

I took this class online.  WOW! I thought I was going to get an easy A but this class was so hard. It required a lot of time and energy.  Dr. Patterson is very nice & helpful & really loves what he does.  I was surprised at my final grade, but I know he saw me trying so I think that helped.  Take this class with caution.

Patterson was an enjoyable teacher. Takes attendance randomly, very helpful and clear with what he is teaching. He was surprisingly helpful and put together even though he had a brand new baby at home! I would take another class from him. Tests require studying, and labs are very helpful. He expects that most students will get a B or higher.
Great professor! Class was kind of boring but it was not terrible by any means. Study for test and you'll do fine. He is extremely helpful- totally recommend

very nice. class is kinda boring, but i dont like geog in the first place. easy online exercises that are 40% of your grade. final and midterm together are 50% and participation is 10%. midterm was easy, final was a little harder. study and youll do fine. would recommend him.

Very professional and knowledgeable professor.  In his 2 hr GEOG class, he hardly lectures and the bulk of your grade comes from his very easy web exercises.  He spot checks attendance about 3 times during the semester.  Textbook used a only for tests.  Theres a mid-term and a final, just allow a little study, and you'll do fine.  Overall easy A.
This is a knowledgable Canadian. Its cool how he says aboot!!
No Comments
Certified ESRI Instructor and does contract work on the side, so he definitely knows his stuff.  Nice balance between challenge and reasonable expectations.
